translation: The fourth verse of the Śrī Śikṣāṣṭakam is as follows:

text: на дганам на джанам на сундарīм
translation: “Oh Lord, I have no desires to accumulate wealth, followers, beautiful women, or salvation. My only prayer is for Your causeless devotional service, birth after birth.”

text: на̄хі ма̄ґі дехо-сукха, відья дгана, джана
translation: O Lord! This is my humble submission at Your lotus feet. I do not ask from You sensual pleasure, learning, wealth or followers.

text: на̄хі ма̄ґі сварґа, а̄ро мокша на̄хі ма̄ґі
на̄ корі пра̄ртхана̄ коно вібгӯтіра ла̄ґі
translation: I do not beg for residence on the celestial planets, nor do I wish liberation from this mundane existence. Nor do I pray for the attainment of any mystic powers.

text: джанме джанме джено тава на̄ма-ґуна ґа̄і
translation: Whatever birth I may obtain due to the results of my previous worldly activities, I pray that I may sing the glories of Your Holy Name birth after birth.

text: еі ма̄тра а̄шя мама тома̄ра чаране
translation: This alone is my cherished hope, my aspiration, my prayer at Your lotus feet: Let causeless and uninterrupted devotion awaken within my heart and flow towards You.

text: бішоє дже прīті ебе а̄чоє а̄ма̄ра
translation: Let me love Your lotus feet as much as I now love sense gratification; transfer my affection from the objects of the senses to Your lotus feet.

text: діне діне бриддгі хаук на̄мера прабга̄ве
translation: In danger or success, good fortune or disaster, let me remain equipoised. And let my affection for You increase day by day by the influence of the Holy Name.

text: пашю-пакши хоє тха̄кі сварґе ба̄ ніроє
translation: Whether I live as bird or beast, in heaven or in hell, let the humble Bhakti Vinod always cherish devotion to You in his heart of hearts.
